description:
Citizen Data is a mission-driven tech start-up focused on helping a diverse set of cross-partisan, bipartisan and nonpartisan organizations, coalitions, and nonprofits harness the power of data and technology to bridge divides and unite Americans around solutions to modern challenges in the public sphere. Citizen offers a full suite of data and analytics services to its clients, including survey research, data management, predictive modeling, analysis, and randomized control trials.

Role Overview

Citizen Data seeks a Summer Data Analyst Intern to assist our data team in both internally and externally facing analytics and modeling projects. Additionally, this person will assist in growing our internal documentation and database management system. The ideal candidate will have experience in or an interest in data management systems, data cleansing and manipulation processes, data visualization, and/or working with data at scale.

This is a paid position or offered in exchange for college credits. Timing is flexible.

Citizen looks at data differently. Citizen seeks a Summer Data Analyst Intern with an innovative, entrepreneurial spirit who can be part of a team pushing the company forward and keep it on the cutting edge of data science.

Role Responsibilities

  • Work with the data team to build out and improve on Citizen’s data infrastructure
  • Interact with our database to pull and store commonly accessed aggregations
  • Pull ad-hoc queries for external partners and internal team members
  • Work closely with Citizen’s data analytics team and produce insights for Citizen’s partners
  • Build data visualization dashboards to help partners understand their data better
  • Learn essential tools of data management and data science, including Amazon Web Services, Python, and SQL
  • Perform research tasks as assigned

Requirements

  • Currently pursuing (or have already attained) a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in data science, economics, computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related technical discipline
  • Experience working Python, SQL, and/or AWS preferred
  • Experience with Tableau, or a similar data visualization platform, preferred
  • Interest in pursuing a career related to data science
  • Interest in a career in policy or non-partisan politics
  • A detail-oriented mindset
  • A problem solver with great data intuition
  • Ability to convey information clearly, both written and verbally

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: $15.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • High school or equivalent (Required)

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

Internship Compensation:

  • Pay
  • College Credit

Company's website:

  • www.citizendata.com

COVID-19 Precaution(s):

  • Remote interview process
  • Virtual meetings

This job is a 100% remote, unpaid internship for college credit.

Apply now

position: Unpaid JavaScript Internship Entry Level - Travel App
description:
Full Stack JavaScript Developer - Intern

Preferred Applicant:

  • Expertise in React.js, Node.js, JavaScript
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science (or working towards one).
  • Passion for photography and travel
  • Demonstrates high academic achievement and leadership skills
  • Organized and well written/spoken.
  • US Citizen
  • Familiarity with social media

About us:

We are a fast-growing tech start-up creating a photocentric, niche travel progressive web application that covers many of the top attractions in the US and Canada.

Mission:

We strive to challenge the creativity and pique the interest of photography minded individuals and those who love the timeless beauty of natural and urban landscapes.

Job Description:

We are looking for a great entry level JavaScript developer who is proficient with React.js, Node.js and JavaScript. Your primary focus will be on developing user interface components and implementing them following well-known React.js workflows. You will ensure that these components and the overall application are robust and easy to maintain. You will coordinate with the rest of the team working on different layers of the infrastructure.

Job Responsibilities:

We are seeking an Software Developer to:

  • Develop new user-facing features using React.js and JavaScript.
  • Building reusable components and front-end libraries for future use
  • Translating designs and wire-frames into high quality code
  • Optimizing components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers
  • Design and implement low-latency, high-availability, performant back-end applications using Node.js.
  • Security and data protection
  • Integration of data storage solutions like MySQL, etc.
  • Setup API integrations with various 3rd parties that enable and optimize business processes
  • Provide test coverage including unit and automated tests
  • Present innovative ideas in which to improve existing systems, processes, or services, including new perspectives based on independent research of the industry.
  • Become an expert on the details and direction of the project to ensure successful implementation of the CEO’s vision.
  • Attend weekly team meetings to contribute strategic and creative solutions unique to start-up companies.
  • Diagnose, report, and brainstorm resolutions to issues as they arise.
  • Hold yourself accountable for submitting work without frequent direction or check-ins.
  • Develop good working relationships with clients, strategic partners and internal teams: be comfortable interacting with and explaining concepts to internal and external audiences
  • Quickly adapt in a fast-paced dynamic business environment

Required Experience:

  • Interest in landscape and nature photography. Interest in travel.
  • Demonstrated proficiency with React.js, Node.js, and JavaScript.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills. Like most companies, we will communicate using Slack, Confluence, Jira and Google Drive.
  • Independent time management to ensure completion of tasks according schedule

What You’ll Learn:

  • Hands-on experience with web development in the start-up world
  • Exposure to financial and technical challenges faced in entrepreneurship and the creative solutions required to solve them
  • Ins and outs of the travel industry, including photography, design, customer relations, social media influence, marketing, and web development/maintenance.

Pay:

Unpaid internship. Learn from and work with expert JS developers on a fun app while building your resume.

Paya (Nasdaq: Paya) is a leading provider of integrated payment and frictionless commerce solutions that help customers accept and make payments, expedite receipt of money, and increase operating efficiencies. The company processes over $30 Billion of annual payment volume across credit/debit card, ACH, and check, making it a top 20 provider of payment processing in the US and #6 overall in e-Commerce. Paya serves more than 100,000 customers through over 2,000 key distribution partners focused on targeted, high growth verticals such as healthcare, education, non-profit, government, utilities, and other B2B goods and services. The business has built its foundation on offering robust integrations into front-end CRM and back-end accounting systems to enhance customer experience and workflow. Paya is headquartered in Atlanta, GA, with offices in Reston, VA, Fort Walton Beach, FL, Dayton, OH, Mt. Vernon, OH and Dallas, TX.

Job Description

Paya is looking for an undergraduate student to assist the PayaConnect Development Team for the summer of 2021. The ideal candidate will contribute in producing, coding, testing and troubleshooting feature for our primary payment gateway. This individual should have development knowledge and experience necessary to design and implement algorithms for handling data-centric workflows and should have knowledge in API development. This is a fulltime internship.

Cornerstone Project:

The interns will be focusing on Payaconnect’s logging and monitoring functionality. This includes standardization on the platform as well as additional monitoring functionality. This project will include development of production code that will be incrementally added to PayaConnect platform during the summer.

Essential Functions

  • Conduct coding in Node.js/Javascript and typescript.
  • Resolves bugs and improve overall system performance.
  • Collaborates with other development teams to implement long term fixes that will reduce overhead and allow better scalability of system.
  • Works in a product development team.
  • Assist in analyzing systems software problems and help with developing technical solutions.
  • Evaluates issues as part of a wholistic review of system health, stability and scalability.
  • Participate in system validation and testing.
  • Attend meetings to help document any discussions, requirements, needed follow-up, etc.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Development experience with either NodeJS or PHP
  • Familiarity with API integrations
  • BDD and/or TDD experience is a plus.
  • Understanding of SQL (MySQL)

Education and Experience

  • Enrolled in four-year program with 3.0 cumulative GPA preferred
  • Major in Computer Science or related field
  • Strong communication and customer service skills

Paya is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

POSITION SUMMARY

  • Perform testing of a variety of Preventice products/projects

WORKING ENVIRONMENT / PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven biopharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialization of small molecule and biologic prescription medicines. AstraZeneca is pioneering innovative research and exploring novel pathways across key therapeutic areas, including respiratory, inflammation and autoimmunity; cardiovascular and metabolic disease; oncology; neuroscience; and infection and vaccines.

We are currently seeking candidates who are working towards obtaining a Masters/PHD in Biostatistics, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Computer Science for a virtual internship this summer of 2021.


What are the objectives/goals of the position?

  • Contributing to the development of proteomics data analysis tool kits

What are the primary duties of this position?

  • Evaluating current statistical methods and developing new methods for proteomics data analysis.

Position Requirements:

  • Good communication, organization skills and meticulous attention to detail are essential.
  • Strong statistical training
  • Programming experience with R/Python
  • Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0

Do you want your voice heard and your actions to count?

Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 5th largest financial group in the world (as ranked by S&P Global, April 2018). In the Americas, we’re 13,000 colleagues, striving to make a difference for every client, organization, and community we serve. We stand for our values, developing positive relationships built on integrity and respect. It’s part of our culture to put people first, listen to new and diverse ideas and collaborate toward greater innovation, speed and agility. We’re a team that accepts responsibility for the future by asking the tough questions and owning the solutions. Join MUFG and be empowered to make your voice heard and your actions count.

Summer Analyst Program Overview:

The Third Line of Defense is a key department within MUFG which includes Internal Audit of the Americas and Americas Credit Review. Our mission is influence management to improve the Governance, Risk Management and System of Internal Control across the Bank. We provide independent and objective assurance of the effectiveness of risk management and control practices, acting as a trusted advisor to the Board of Directors, Senior Management and other key stakeholders. We independently assess First and Second Line managements’ ability to effectively identify, measure, monitor, and control risk.
  • Innovative – We continuously improve our practices and provide an inspiring environment that engages employees and equips them for success.
  • Influential – We challenge ourselves and the way management thinks about and responds to risk.
  • Impactful – We deliver results that help management strengthen the Bank’s governance, risk management and internal controls.
We are seeking high achievers that are intellectually curious, enthusiastic, and have a strong work ethic. Individuals that work well in a team-oriented environment and will help drive our business forward.

Experience & Training:

The Third Line internship program takes place over the course of a 10-week period, from June to August. During the 10 weeks, Summer Analysts are placed in one business area, which allows them to quickly develop the skills and knowledge required to become an integral part of the team. The Analysts will have the opportunity to participate in various trainings, roundtables and work assignments that allow them to build their skills and expertise within the department.

Support & Guidance:

The assigned mentor/manager will provide goals and professional development guidance and conduct performance reviews as a commitment to our summer analysts. The summer analyst will also have the opportunity to network with employees across different lines of business and at all levels of the organization. In our open and inclusive environment, senior colleagues will get to know the summer analysts over the course of the internship and will see the impact of the work being done. Summer analysts will leave the bank with a better understanding of the Third Line of Defense and it’s overall impact on the organization.

Career Progression:

At the end of the program, the opportunity exists to receive an offer for full-time employment upon graduation. This decision will be made based on the performance of the student throughout the summer and department needs.


Qualifications:
  • Currently a 2021 rising senior; graduating Winter 2021 or Spring 2022
  • Strong interest or majoring in Audit, Accounting, Finance, Business Management, Computer Science, Economics and Engineering.
  • Generally, a GPA of 3.0 and above
  • You have excellent academic standing with recommended course work in finance, accounting or economics
  • Excellent computer skills specifically with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)
  • Strong verbal, writing, mathematical, problem-solving and statistical skills
  • You have interpersonal skills and individual initiative, leadership qualities and the ability to develop creative solutions
  • Ability to work independently as well as in teams
  • You are a standout student who can excel in a challenging environment with a strong desire to continuously improve and learn new things
  • You have a reputation for integrity, accuracy, consistency
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified.

Overview:
Are you the type of person who loves learning new programming languages in your free time?

Have you created an application, just for fun?

If these are the types of things that you're interested in, and you’re passionate about Christ, we have the internship for you!

During this internship, you will experience what it's like to be on a team of full stack developers that are responsible for creating systems that aid in our ability to deliver media.
The work that you do will have real world impact! How would you like to create a System Monitoring tool that monitors our staging and production web applications using "real user behavior" tests? Not only will something like this alert us to potential issues before users encounter them, but it will allow us to automatically deploy infrastructure and framework updates to staging (then production) with confidence that the upgrades won't break anything. This will accelerate the pace of deploying security updates. THAT is the kind of impact that you can have on the ministry!


Qualifications:

  • A current student in your third or fourth year of college, pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in MIS, Computer Science, or equivalent.
  • Programming experience (coursework or project work) and an understanding of how web applications get delivered. Python or web development (backend) a plus! Desire to learn.
  • Systems Administration experience (coursework or project work) with Linux & Windows, and a desire to learn.
  • A self-motivated, self-driven problem solver who takes the initiative to come up with creative solutions.
  • Able to work in a team environment and contribute to further the overall success of the team versus self-advancement.
  • Able to listen effectively, respectful of others’ perspectives and contributions, and be able to both offer and accept feedback openly.
  • Passionate for learning and have a desire to help others.
  • And a sense of humor (passion for puns is a plus!)


What can you expect from us?

During this internship, you will experience EMF life; working in a collaborative, innovative & technical environment with a team that is committed to serving Christ in all that we do. The work that you will do will be meaningful and contribute to furthering the ministry. Our host department will coach, mentor and challenge you. You will learn about your selected field, but more importantly, you will learn about yourself.


Throughout the course of this internship, you’ll learn from our team of leaders, gaining knowledge of the media industry and business acumen to better prepare you for the business world which lies ahead of you.


Location: Rocklin, CA or remote

Start Date: During your Summer break (specific start date is flexible)

Hours: 400 hours max. The work can be done M-F on PT or FT basis

Hourly Rate: $16/hr

Company Description


DNAnexus is the leading cloud-based SaaS company serving the global life science community. DNAnexus' health informatics platform serves customers across a spectrum of industries — government, biopharmaceutical, clinical diagnostics, healthcare, and academic research in 33 countries with compliant protection of data, privacy, and intellectual property. The platform provides a secure and collaborative environment where genomics, multi-omics, and real world data can be combined with clinical data at scale, providing new insights that can lead to improved diagnostics, new targeted therapies and better patient care. For more information on DNAnexus, please visit www.dnanexus.com or follow the company @DNAnexus.


Job Description


We're looking for interns to join our technical scientific outreach team! If you are an intellectually curious and driven student in a graduate or undergraduate program looking for a rewarding internship that combines your passion for science, product development and business, we should talk.

The Science Intern will work closely with the rest of the DNAnexus Research Platform Team to build tools, example resources, training and other documentation to support research done with data provided by UK Biobank and other large datasets.

This includes:

  • Making cool projects related to machine learning, data federation, spark, image analysis and other realms of data science digestible by and presentable to data scientists
  • Understanding and then organizing optimal workflows for bioinformatics and image analysis for researchers who will use the UK Biobank dataset.

Qualified applicants will be currently enrolled college or graduate students in a bioinformatics or another genomics/computational biology-related degree program OR is in a business or software management program with a strong passion and background related to bioinformatics, genomics, or precision medicine.

Requirements:

  • Experience with or exposure to software development.
  • Experience with rapid software prototyping
  • Self-starter approach to work, with an eagerness to consistently meet and exceed objectives
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic, entrepreneurial environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to prioritize and execute on initiatives
  • Detail-oriented with high standards of quality work
  • Ability to interact and team with others is essential. Must be able to partner within organization to generate results
  • Demonstrated analytical capabilities including the ability to analyze and report metrics
  • Technical skills, one or more or the following: R, Python, Jupyter Notebooks, github, bioinformatics pipelines

Qualifications


Education and Certifications:

  • Currently attending a graduate or undergraduate program in Bioinformatics, Genetics, Computational Biology,, Computer Science, or business (MBA or Technology Management preferred).
  • For business or computer science majors, coursework or another degree in science (biology, genetics, bioinformatics) medicine or healthcare a plus.

Additional Information


Why Our Work Is Important

Science is social. It is about discovering, sharing and building upon the findings of others. For biomedical data to realize its true value, it requires openness and collaboration, but at the same time a secure environment to handle sensitive information. DNAnexus provides a dynamic platform where data protection, analysis, and collaboration allow for open conversations, new ideas and precise outcomes. Precision medicine is the future. Join our team and be a part of this revolution, delivering on the potential to predict, prevent, and personalize treatments through precision medicine.

If you are interested in joining our team, please apply today!

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

We’re looking for a Full Stack Intern to help the RippleNet Engineering Team design and build applications that enable us to build out our growing network and improve the global payments infrastructure. This role would be perfect for someone that wants to work at an agile startup that leverages blockchain technology to create value for fintech customers. You’ll be working closely with our engineering, product and UX teams to ensure a high-quality service for our highly engaged members.

Ripple’s product offering is currently built using and React, TypeScript, GraphQL, and Java Spring microservices. You will work directly with our senior engineers to add new features, fix bugs, and support releases for our flagship user experience - RippleNet Home. This is an opportunity to learn best practices and gain experience in architecture, system design, and product development.

What you’ll do:

  • Build client-facing web applications integrating with blockchain technologies and all forms of currencies (traditional as well as crypto)
  • Participate in the full software development lifecycle, from software design and requirements gathering, to unit and integration testing
  • Integrate with the XRP Ledger, a distributed ledger built on the principles of Blockchain and its native currency XRP, the fastest and most scalable digital asset
  • Work with teams across the organization, including product, design, marketing, integrations, ops, customer success, legal etc

What we’re looking for:

  • Junior and Senior students studying towards a degree in CS, EE or a related technical field
  • Experience in either front-end or backend development, but interest in how to build full-stack applications.
  • Our stack is ReactJS (TypeScript) on the front-end and Java (Spring) on the back-end and. We don’t discriminate by language but you could have built side projects in Java (Spring), ReactJS, Node.js, Ruby on Rails, or Python (Django)
  • Interests: entrepreneurship, economics and financial markets, strong work ethic, creative thinking, systems thinking, cryptography, creative logic, fast-paced environment

WHAT WE OFFER:

  • The chance to work in a fast-paced start-up environment with experienced industry leaders
  • A learning environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impact
  • Design laptop, software and headphones on loan
  • Regionally competitive hourly rate
  • Weekly company meeting - ask me anything style discussion with our Leadership Team
  • Team outings to sports games, happy hours, game nights and more!

WHO WE ARE:

Ripple provides one frictionless experience to send money globally using the power of blockchain. By joining Ripple’s growing, global network (RippleNet), financial institutions can process their customers’ payments anywhere in the world instantly, reliably and cost-effectively. Banks and payment providers can use the digital asset XRP to further reduce their costs and access new markets.

With offices in San Francisco, New York, London, Mumbai, Singapore, São Paulo, Reykjavík, Washington D.C. and Dubai, Ripple has more than 300 customers around the world.

position: Data Science Computer Vision Intern at UIUC Research Park - Summer 2021
description:
YOU MUST CURRENTLY BE ENROLLED AT THE UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS, URBANA-CHAMPAIGN (UIUC) FOR THIS INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITY WITH CARGILL AT THE UIUC RESEARCH PARK

Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who use new technologies, dynamic insights and over 154 years of experience to connect farmers with markets, customers with ingredients, and people and animals with the food they need to thrive. In partnership with Cargill, at the University of Illinois, Urbana Champaign (UIUC) research park, you will be given the opportunity as a graduate level intern to apply knowledge gained in the classroom to a real-life environment and then multiply by tenfold.

As a Data Science Computer Vision Intern, you will work collaboratively in multidisciplinary teams to develop proof of concepts, minimum viable products and fully deployable solutions. In this role, you will create complex predictive and optimization models that help deliver significant value to our businesses and functions. The focus of this role will be on manufacturing and operations problems.

Key Accountabilities:
Continuously seek out best practices and develop skills.

Work on multidisciplinary teams of data engineers, software engineers, data scientists, and business subject-matter experts to deliver complex projects on time and within budgets.

Work with mentor to translate ambiguous and complex business problems into project charters clearly identifying technical risks and project scope.

Take ownership for the data science workflow including exploratory data analysis, model development, and potentially deployment.

Independently handle issues with minimal supervision, while working closely with mentor for more complex issues.

Other duties as assigned

Job Location: University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign in Champaign, IL

Required Qualifications:
Must be currently enrolled in a Masters or PhD program at the University of Illinois, Urbana Champaign in Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Computational Linguistics, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Physics, or related fields with a graduation date of December 2021 or later.

Able to complete a minimum 12-week internship in Summer 2021 (May/June - August 2021)

Experience developing and testing machine learning or statistical projects.

Strong background in Computer Vision including image/video processing, object detection, classification and tracking. Knowledge and experience on using deep learning tools (e.g. TensorFlow, MXNet, PyTorch, etc.) for image/video analytics

Proficiency in Python (e.g., pandas, scikit-learn, bokeh, matplotlib, NumPy)

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.

Interested in learning model deployment in a production setting

Preferred Qualifications:
Right to work in the United States without via sponsorship.

Strong SQL skills

Strong data visualization skills

Experience in agriculture

Experience in a software development environment and code management or versioning

Experience working with AWS

Experience working with Hadoop and other distributed computing frameworks

Experience working with continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) pipelines

We will set you up with all the necessary tools to perform the job from your home office.

Earnest empowers people with the financial capital they need to live better lives.

We're an accomplished team of technology, finance, and design geeks who believe consumer lending can be radically improved and are doing something about it. We are disrupting the trillion dollar student loan industry by redefining what it means to be creditworthy. We created a company that combines data science, streamlined design, and technology to:

  • Build products that simplify the lending process
  • Personalize loans to suit the needs of our customers
  • Engage with our customers through more human experiences

Our culture is one that values transparency and blameless problem solving. Earnest has a strong track record of employee growth and career progression. Earnies are empathetic, product-focused, proactive, and curious.

On the server side, we use Node.js. On the client-side we use React/Redux for building new things and Angular for everything else. We deploy services in Docker and Kubernetes on AWS. We integrate with other internal microservices (written in Node.js and Scala) and store the bulk of our data in Postgres and Amazon S3.

  • Embrace challenges, learn fast, and provide great results.
  • Grow your coding skills through mentoring and peer reviews and gain firsthand experience with industry best practices for agile software delivery.
  • Participate in code reviews, project demonstrations, team retrospectives and other agile ceremonies with the team.
  • Be a part of a friendly, fun, and exciting FinTech environment!

Ideal background and expertise:

  • You will work remotely for 12 weeks starting in May or June 2021 as a paid intern
  • You are currently enrolled in a Master's program with a Computer science focus or related degree (recently graduated within a year) OR finished intensive training in Software Development.
  • Experience with one or more relevant coding languages (Javascript, Java, C++). Preferred experience with NodeJS, ReactJS, AngularJS, SQL. Other technology experience to look for: AWS, Docker, Jenkins, microservices
  • Demonstrated interest and ability to learn other coding languages.

Earnest Perks & Benefits:

  • Great culture with an awesome team

ALLETE is an innovative company with more than a century of experience engaged in transforming the energy landscape in the upper Midwest. Our businesses include: Minnesota Power, the largest electric utility in northern Minnesota; BNI Energy in North Dakota; ALLETE Clean Energy, a developer of energy projects with limited environmental impact; Superior Water, Light and Power in Superior, Wisconsin; and ALLETE Renewable Resources, which operates and maintains wind generation facilities in North Dakota.

What will I do?

If hired, you would join ALLETE’s Cyber Technology Services department and would assist the ALLETE Clean Energy Cyber Technology Team. ALLETE provides Interns with the opportunity to collaborate with employees, participate in real projects, learn new skills and gain valuable experience. Whatever your IT interests, if you are a motivated self-starter with a passion for digging in to the details figuring out how something works, or finding a better way of doing things, we would love to talk to you about this opportunity.

Responsibilities for the ACE Cyber Technology Intern will include, but not limited to the following:

  • Assist in validation and improvement of data historian and analytics systems.
  • Develop intelligent reporting and visualization of operational data.
  • Advance the monitoring and awareness of Operational Systems.
  • Integrate vendor documentation and specifications into Operational Data systems.

Opportunities to work with the following will also be available:

  • VMWare Virtualization platforms.
  • Industrial networking and communications protocols.
  • Scripting and automation tool development.

To really grab our attention, tell us about your experiences with any of the following:

  • PowerShell scripting, Linux shell scripting, and/or other scripting languages
  • Python, JavaScript or other programming languages/frameworks
  • Database and Data Analytics concepts
  • Linux systems
  • Cyber Security

What are the qualifications for this internship?

  • Must be enrolled in a Bachelor's degree program in Computer Science, Information Systems, Electrical Engineering or Data Analytics with an expected graduation date between June 2021 to December 2023
  • Cumulative GPA: 3.0 or higher

This internship will last from May - August 2021.

  • Performs exploratory data analysis and visualizations of multivariate clinical data sets
  • Works closely with software engineering and other Data Scientists to test algorithms

REQUIRED
  • Pursuing degree in computer science, mathematics, applied statistics, physics, engineering or similar disciplines

Job Description

Cognex will be coming to the MSOE campus this fall to interview students for internships. In order to be considered, both a resume and transcripts must be attached to this job posting when applying.

Availability: Part Time (10-15 hours weekly) 2020-2021 school year, Full-Time summer 2021

Qualifications: Currently enrolled in or completed Freshman year of undergrad

Degrees: Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science

Skills: C# skill a plus.

Positions (3): Summer internships will join our Milwaukee engineering teams working on various software development projects, software test projects, or dev-ops infrastructure projects. Assignments will be based on individual skill sets, areas of interest, and areas of need that Cognex has. Demonstrated skill and passion for software development may lead to more complex development assignments over the course of the internship. All positions will be evaluated at the end of the summer to determine student and Cognex interest in continuing the internship part-time through the next school year or summer.

What is Cognex?

Cognex is the world’s leading producer of machine vision systems and bar code scanners for the industrial automation and logistics markets. We make high speed cameras with embedded microcontrollers and DSPs that are used to do robot guidance, inspection, measurement, flaw detection and much more in the factory automation world on virtually any product you might purchase at a store, including everything from automotive to medical to food. Cognex also specializes in designing the world’s hottest selling machine vision-based 1D and 2D barcode reading devices. These products are purchased by the thousands by huge logistics companies across the world to automate their warehousing. While Cognex makes a really cool high-tech product, it is an equally cool company. We boast a unique “Work Hard, Play Hard, Move Fast” culture that finds us whitewater rafting, playing disc golf, doing wine and beer tastings and more on company-sponsored “Play Hard” days.

What is the Cognex Milwaukee Engineering Center?

Started in 1998 with less than 9 engineers, Cognex-Milwaukee has become one of Cognex’s most important engineering teams, with nearly 40 engineers on site and responsibility for the world’s #1 selling machine vision system, In-Sight. The Milwaukee team creates embedded factory networking software, user-interface software for In-Sight’s programming tools, and Software Quality Assurance tests for these high-tech products. Our team has a long history with MSOE, boasting numerous former MSOE Computer and Software Engineering alumni on staff. A large majority of these ‘Cognoids’ started their careers at Cognex as interns! Can you prove you are among the ‘best of the best” and earn your way onto our growing staff of high-tech engineers? Check out www.cognex.com to find out more about our products and our rapidly growing company!

Submit your resume and transcripts and let’s have a conversation about how you can make a difference on our growing team!

About Cognex Corporation

Cognex is the global leader in vision-based inspection, guidance and identification systems that give machines the power to “see.” Our technology helps improve the quality and reduce the cost of billions of products that are manufactured every day.

Cognex Corporation designs, develops, manufactures, and markets a range of products that incorporate sophisticated machine vision technology that gives them the ability to “see.” Cognex products include bar code readers, machine vision sensors, and machine vision systems that are used in factories, warehouses, and distribution centers around the world to guide, gauge, inspect, identify, and assure the quality of items during the manufacturing and distribution process.

Cognex is the world’s leader in the machine vision industry, having shipped more than 1 million vision-based products, representing over $4 billion in cumulative revenue, since the company’s founding in 1981. Headquartered in Natick, Massachusetts, USA, Cognex has regional offices and distributors located throughout the Americas, Europe, and Asia.

With over $700 million of cash in the bank and no debt, we are a financially strong international company with a culture that maintains the fast paced, creative environment of a startup. Our employees, proudly called “Cognoids,” take their work seriously, but don't take themselves seriously. Our Work Hard, Play Hard, Move Fast culture recognizes our employees for their innovation, perseverance and hard work in a fun, rewarding, and quirky environment.

Working at Cognex: At Cognex, you’ll find a dedicated and talented team of people who enjoy their work and take pride in their accomplishments. Cognex offers a dynamic work environment shaped by our mission and values, and a corporate culture that combines creativity, fun, and humor with a dedication to excellence. If you are looking for a financially strong, global company that is the leader in its industry...but one that maintains the fast-paced, creative environment of a start up...Cognex is the right place for you.

Learn more from actual Cognoids by watching our video or apply directly by visiting: http://www.cognexjobs.com

Our Vaisala solutions contribute to societies and people’s lives in over 150 countries – and can even be found in space. With our technological innovations for measuring weather, environmental and industrial conditions, we have a key role in solving the grand social and environmental challenges of our time. We offer you a career with a clear purpose and a chance to create observations for a better world.


Building on over 80 years of experience, we employ approximately 1,900 professionals worldwide today. We are listed on the Nasdaq Helsinki stock exchange and our headquarters is located in Finland.


Vaisala’s industry-leading weather observation technologies, instruments, and solutions lay the foundation for the Weather and Environment business area’s strategy, enabling our customers to improve their ability to measure and forecast weather and weather phenomena. The business area serves selected weather-dependent customers to whom accurate, real-time, uninterrupted, and reliable weather data is essential to run efficient operations.

Position Description:

Accurate lightning detection information is extremely valuable to applications in the electric power industry, airports, insurance validation, and wildfire management, among others. Vaisala has an ongoing research study to validate the performance of its lightning detection systems and improve algorithms. In this summer project, the student will assist in taking high fidelity observations of lightning events to improve lightning type classification and continuing current identification. In particular, the work will involve time-stamped video observations. Assistance with other equipment to measure electric field changes may also be required. The project may also include multiple trips into the field to deploy, test, and monitor the measurement equipment. This internship will give the student valuable experience working on an important validation study in a commercial environment.


Key responsibilities include:

The goals of the internship are to assist senior scientists in the lab and in the field to collect valuable event data on lightning characteristics. We particularly seek assistance with setting up, testing, and deploying a time-stamped and triggered moderate-speed video acquisition system to include:

  • moderate-frame rate camera (on the of order 1000 fps)
  • GPS receiver to time-stamp all video frames
  • triggering mechanism based on either or both of (1) a local-area lightning sensor or (2) manual triggering; objective is to record only brief periods of interest (lightning in the area)
  • pre-trigger interval on the order of 0.5-1 second

Qualifications:

  • Senior undergraduate student through MS-level candidate encouraged to apply
  • Major in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science preferred
  • Practical laboratory experience and familiarity with hardware engineering best practices
  • Familiarity with photography / video and GPS desired

Please send your application including CV and salary request soon. We will close the application process when we have a suitable number of qualified candidates.


ANTICIPATED SALARY RANGE: $20-25 per hour. (Salary is determined by the education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market data). This is a 10-week, temporary position and is not eligible for employment benefits.

We take pride in being pioneers who strive to bring about positive changes in both the society and environment, and our work is not done yet. Take advantage of this opportunity and join our team to make a difference!


What we offer:

Our innovative high-tech business provides opportunities for curious challenge-seekers to make a real difference. As a part of our global team you can contribute with science and technology to solve the big environmental and societal challenges of our time.


Vaisala offers a competitive benefits package including: health, dental, and vision insurance, flexible spending accounts, company paid life, long and short term disability, 401(K) plan with company match, and tuition reimbursement. We also offer holiday pay and a generous paid time off plan.


To be considered for this position you must currently be eligible to work in the U.S. Vaisala participates in the E-Verify employment verification system. Candidates are subject to a personal work preference assessment and complete background check prior to an offer being extended.

GIS Intern working in the Environmental Stewardship section of the Willamette Valley Project (WVP) for the Army Corps of Engineers. WVP is a major water resource project responsible for operating 13 dams and managing natural resources and recreation in the lakes and surrounding lands. We manage nearly 50,000 acres in the Willamette, McKenzie, and Santiam watersheds. The Environmental Stewardship section is known for their community partnerships in natural resource preservation and restoration.

Primary duties include data acquisition, data management, natural resource GIS mapping, and field GPS data collection. Data analysis for projects related to cultural and historic resources, Master Plan development, threatened and endangered plants and wildlife, invasive plants, habitat restoration, easements and land ownership, and hydrology. Additional duties may include field support of other natural resource programs such as botany, wildlife biology, cultural resources monitoring, boundary surveys and park operations.

  • Training Provided

Job Description

Takeda Pharmaceutical Company Limited is hiring interns for summer 2021!


Are you looking for a patient-focused, innovation-driven company that will inspire and empower you to shine? Join Takeda as an Biotech Summer Intern! At Takeda, we are transforming the pharmaceutical industry through our R&D driven market leadership and being a values led company. We empower our people to realize their potential through life-changing work. Certified as a Global Top Employer, we offer stimulating careers, encourage innovation, and strive for excellence in everything we do. We foster a diverse, inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our global teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world. Here, you will be a vital contributor to our inspiring, bold mission

The Internship Program is designed to be both educational and practical. Interns will learn how to take skills acquired in school and apply them in a professional setting. The Intern will gain a better understanding of the work environment in a specific role and how it supports a biotech manufacturing setting. The candidate will also have opportunities to work with other interns and departments.

The Biotech Summer Internship is a 12-week program where interns will sharpen their skills through a variety of experiences including ownership of daily responsibilities and participation in special projects. Internship roles are modeled and designed to challenge interns to learn, adapt, and add value to their teams, while learning new skills.

Program features include:

  • Each intern is assigned a peer mentor to help introduce them to Takeda’s corporate culture and values.
  • Through formal training and on-the-job experiences, we are committed to developing interns in areas specific to their education and interest while exposing them to Takeda’s technologies, product lines and global environment.
  • Throughout the course of the summer, interns will have the opportunity to attend networking and development events

Internships are assigned based on business need as well as candidate interest. Assignments are designed to challenge interns to adapt and add value to the position they hold. Some areas where an intern can expect to work are Manufacturing, EHS, Supply Chain, Business Excellence and Quality. Below are a few examples of rotational options:

  • Manufacturing—responsible for learning, understanding and leading manufacturing processes and/or team as well as support systems that ensure quality and on-time delivery of product in a safe manner.
  • Engineering- Work to support manufacturing floor with the equipment, design, and troube-shooting areas when needed.
  • EHS- works to conduct risk-assessments, ergo(how ever you spell that word where they look at how you are sitting in a chair) assessments, and safety training to employees of the company
  • Quality —ensure adequate adherence and deployment of quality systems such as batch record review, product release, change control, exception management, and product annual reviews.
  • Supply Chain—learn distribution, purchasing, warehouse operations and planning within a manufacturing environment
  • Business Excellence- works closely with the manufacturing process to implement improvements to the process. Uses six sigma and process improvement techniques
  • EH&S- conducts and leads risk-assessments, sustainability efforts, and safety training for site

Program Timeline:

  • The internship will have two start dates: June 1st and June 15th
  • Expected completion of internship is September 2021

Minimum Requirements:

  • Must be pursing an associates or bachelors degree
  • Degrees in Engineering (Chemical, Biomedical, Electrical); Hard Sciences (Chemistry, Biology, Biochemistry); or Environmental Health and Safety, IT, Psychology, or Computer Science preferred
  • 3.0 GPA or higher
  • Must be a US Citizen, lawful permanent resident of the US, or otherwise authorized to work in the US without requiring sponsorship now or in the future.

Qualifications:

  • Passion for improving patients lives and healthcare advancement
  • Demonstrates excellent skills in oral and written communication, organization, and prioritization of tasks
  • Critical/analytical thinking that drives conclusions and problem resolution
  • Exhibits leadership skills including personal accountability, decision quality, customer focus, drive for results, with integrity and trust
  • Excellent interpersonal and relationship-building skills, experience with cross-cultural environment preferred
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
  • Ability to effectively manage multiple priorities and work under pressure

Physical Demands:

  • Must be able to lift, push, pull and carry up to 25 lbs.
  • In general, the position requires a combination of sedentary work and walking around observing conditions in the facility.

Working Environment:

  • Must be able to work in controlled environments requiring special gowning. Will be required to follow gowning requirements and wear protective clothing over the head, face, hands, feet and body.
  • No make-up, jewelry, contact lenses, nail polish or artificial fingernails may be worn in the manufacturing environment.
  • Will work in a cold, wet environment
  • Must be able to work multiple shifts, including weekends.
  • Must be able to work overtime as required.
  • May be required to work in a confined area.
  • Some Clean Room and cool/hot storage conditions.

Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a global technology and data company that builds verification, optimization, and analytics solutions for the advertising industry and we're looking for a Data Engineering Intern to join our Data Engineering team. If you are excited by technology that has the power to handle hundreds of thousands of transactions per second; collect tens of billions of events each day; and evaluate thousands of data-points in real-time all while responding in just a few milliseconds, then IAS is the place for you!

Our data pipelines process between 2B to 5B events per hour. Experience gained on such data pipelines are in high demand. As a Data Engineering Intern you will work with more senior engineers in building new data pipelines on AWS, migrate pipelines to AWS or extend features and optimize performance of existing data pipelines.

  • Attend intern activities designed to allow you to develop your skills, better understand your career interests and identify opportunities for future employment
  • Network with other interns and IAS employees

Who you are and what you have:

  • A rising senior actively working towards obtaining a BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field looking for a full-time position upon graduation
  • Relevant coursework, and interest, in build, test, automation, and DevOps frameworks
  • Experience programming in object oriented languages such as Java, C++, Scala or Python as well as proficiency in Linux
  • Basic understanding of algorithms and data structures
  • Ability to communicate clearly, verbally and in writing
  • Effective time management skills and ability to work in a team atmosphere

What puts you over the top:

  • Some practical experience working on AWS or another cloud provider
  • Some practical experience developing with Apache Spark and/or Hive
  • Good knowledge of SQL and experience with columnar datastores

Personalis is a rapidly growing cancer genomics company transforming the development of next-generation therapies by providing more comprehensive molecular data about each patient's cancer and immune response. Our ImmunoID NeXT Platform® is enabling the development of next generation immuno-oncology therapeutics and diagnostics.

Summary:

You will join a team of bioinformaticians and software engineers whose mission is to develop robust, high-performance software that can accurately and reliably analyze large volumes of next-generation sequencing (NGS) data. Our bioinformatics software provides the foundation for a wide range of clinical and research applications, from genetic disease research, to cancer clinical diagnostics, to leading-edge developments in immuno-oncology.

We are offering to a summer internship opportunity to promising STEM students who have a professional interest in Bioinformatics. This internship will offer you direct exposure to real world industry applications of bioinformatics to the rapidly growing immuno-oncology space and will focus on developing you in areas which your academic curriculum typically does not.

The internship will be approximately 10-12 weeks in duration (dates flexible depending on your academic calendar); the emphasis of this internship program is to gain exposure to best research & development practices in Bioinformatics.

Responsibilities:

Support R&D efforts to explore new methods and technologies in a cutting-edge Bioinformatics Engineering group at a rapidly growing company. You will be responsible for a summer project from conception through feasibility, development, testing and rolling into "production".

During the 10-12-week program, you will:

  • Understand current challenges in immuno-oncology, Bioinformatics, Next Generation Sequencing and high-performance computing and where you can best focus your academic research for direct industry applications.
  • Select your summer project with direct industry application(s).
  • Create a project plan for your summer project with tight scope and realistic deadlines.
  • Leverage Agile development practices as more information about your summer project becomes available during the development process.
  • Participate in our weekly Kanban planning and semi-weekly standups.
  • Leverage Linux, Bash and Python for effective bioinformatics analysis on large datasets
  • Version control software source code and file system resources and gain exposure to common versioning/branching strategies.
  • Learn coding standards/conventions and undergo at least one code review of your project before the Bioinformatics Engineering group.
  • Write regression and unit tests to ensure desired functionality over time.
  • Automated deployments & automated testing, signifying your work is ready for "production".
  • Presentation of your summer project to the Personalis Research & Development group.

Please note that all Bioinformatics Engineering group members are required to work on Pacific Standard Time.

A successful intern will emerge with valuable, hands-on industry experience and find him/herself in a fantastic position for a career in private sector Bioinformatics Research & Development.

Requirements:

  • In progress degree (Bachelors, Masters or Ph.D.) in a STEM field.
  • Candidate must desire a career in Bioinformatics.
  • Exposure to Bioinformatics not required, although candidates without a Bioinformatics background must have a strong Mathematics, Statistics and/or Computer Science background.
  • The ideal candidate will be completing their junior year of undergrad, or first year of graduate school at a top university and will be returning to school in the fall.
  • Software development experience
    • Experience with one common scripting language such as Python or Perl.
    • Familiarity with Unix/Linux or OS X command line
  • Due to COVID-19 pandemic, this position will be 100% remote but only available to candidates residing in and authorized to work in the United States.

Application process:

  • Submit your resume at https://boards.greenhouse.io/personalisinc by April 25th, 2021.
    • No cover letter necessary.
  • Please list one academic reference under the box "If you were referred, please provide Personalis employee name:".
    • Please indicate the institution, like "Dr. von Neumann (Princeton University)"
    • References will not be contacted unless you are selected for the interview process.
  • Candidates selected for interview process will be informed by April 30th
  • Video interviews and programming assessment through week of May 3-5th
  • Start/end of internship flexible based on academic calendar.

Personalis is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabilities. Personalis offers a competitive compensation package.

position: Intern to focus on the cause of Homelessness and Make a Difference!
description:
Nonprofit Internships and Volunteer Opportunities

Cause: Homelessness

Manhattan OR Remote / Virtual / Work from Home

Many students, recent graduates, and professionals have lost (or been unable to find) internships or jobs due to COVID-19. We feel so bad for all those who have been impacted in that way.

While we cannot pay, our nonprofit does offer an outstanding opportunity to use your skills, gain experience, enhance your resume, and make a tremendous positive social impact on the causes or communities you care about, including Homelessness.

Greatest Impact

This may be the single best opportunity for you to make the greatest possible positive impact in the world.

Who Is It For?

We have many roles to fill here, so we need high-achieving interns and volunteers with a range of experience. We therefore welcome:

· Professionals who want to volunteer part-time

· "Dependent Spouses" of H1-B, F1, and L1 visa holders

· Recent graduates, including international students on OPT

· Undergraduate and graduate school students, including international students on CPT, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

· Outstanding high school students, who want to intern or to join us as a school ambassador

Credit for Students

Internships with ChangingThePresent are eligible for credit from many schools, and we are happy to do our part to meet the school's requirements.

When

We are always hiring: school year or summer; full-time or part-time.

About Us

ChangingThePresent.org is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit. The New York Times called us an “Amazon.com of the nonprofit world.”

We make the experience of a donation, which you can give in a friend’s name, feel like a rewarding present and an appealing alternative to buying and giving yet more unwanted "stuff." In this way, we are starting to channel to nonprofits some of the $450 billion Americans spend each year buying birthday, wedding, holiday, and corporate presents. Imagine how much good we could all do together as more of that money goes to making a difference.

· Our visitors can contribute to provide school children with their first book, preserve an acre of the wilderness, fund an hour of cancer research, etc.

· Wish lists and registries let them share their dreams for a better world.

· Personalized greeting cards make a charitable gift especially memorable. Gift cards let friends support the things they care about.

We already work with hundreds of the most prestigious nonprofits in the country, and we are now opening the site to all nonprofits so they can all attract additional funding for their important missions.

Unprecedented Opportunities for Responsibility and Leadership

Our interns and volunteers get more responsibility than they would anywhere else. You can take a leadership role.

Focus on Homelessness Nonprofits

We seek high-achieving interns and volunteers who want to take a leadership role and make a difference for the cause of Homelessness.

You can also choose to focus on your favorite causes (including education, hunger, women, children, cancer, human rights, environment, women, veterans, etc.) or the charitable needs of any ethnic group, religious group, city, or country. Please see the growing list of causes, countries, cities, ethnic groups, and religious groups on which we focus at https://changingthepresent.org/collections/gifts

For the Homelessness and Every Cause, Interns and Volunteers Will do the Following:

· Identify, research, prioritize, and invite potential Advisors and Experts.

· Identify, research, prioritize, and invite nonprofits, who can register and list their charitable gifts at no cost. The opportunity for them is discussed in the slideshow on this page: https://changingthepresent.org/pages/for-nonprofits

· Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch magazines, websites, blogs, professional organizations, social media channels, online communities, and other ways to reach people who care about each specific cause.

· Identify, research, and pitch strategic partners for the cause.

· Identify, research, prioritize, and pitch sources of growth funding (philanthropists, corporations, or foundations)

· Conceive of and create cause marketing sponsorship proposals.

· Identify and invite the promotional support of celebrities who support the cause/community.

Focus on Ethnic, Religious, City, or Country Communities

We also have opportunities to focus on the charitable needs of any ethnic, religious, city, or country communities.

Opportunities for Most Areas of Academic / Professional Focus

We also have positions that align with a wide range of academic and professional fields, including business development, analytics, finance, accounting, technology, web development, Salesforce, database, computer science, science, STEM education, marketing, digital marketing, communications, social media, publishing, Human Resources, organizational psychology, research, education, and graphics.

Specific Markets

Some interns focus on specific markets, such as the high school market, college market, wedding market, or corporate gift market.

You Benefit

We want all our interns to get the following from their experience here:

· Make a tremendous positive impact in the world.

· Use your skills, experience, knowledge, creativity and talent.

· Assume responsibility and take a leadership role.

· Learn a tremendous amount.

· Work with people from around the world in a diverse and supportive community, and have a great time.

· Enhance your resume with a record of professional achievement and community service.

· Receive a great letter of recommendation.

When

We welcome full-time and part-time interns during the school year and/or the summer. We are entrepreneurial and flexible, and we are always hiring.

Where

Our office is conveniently located at 7th Avenue and 33 Streets in Manhattan. We also have interns who work remotely (as are all of us during the pandemic).

Please Share

We hope you will also share this opportunity with anyone who might be interested.

* *Learn More and Apply Now

Read more about our internships at:

https://ChangingThePresent.org/pages/interns-and-volunteers.

Then, please send a resume and short cover letter about your specific interests and your available dates/days/hours to: join [AT] ChangingThePresent [DOT] org.

Thank you very much!

  • Soft Skills

Ability to work well with others, ability to be flexible and adapt to changes quickly, ability to follow directions and positively respond to feedback and ability to communicate effectively with team members

  • Technical Skills

Ability to gain solid understanding of software development concepts and methods, ability to learn principles and practices associated with agile product model including requirement analysis, software development and software testing and ability to learn Java and J2EE technologies.


Education:
  • Candidate pursuing a degree in Computer Science or similar degree required.
  • GPA of 3.0 or higher required.
The Company:
Arch Mortgage Internship Program
  • In your 10-week internship, expect to network with executives, participate in intern events and programs and become part of the Arch MI team.
  • This is a paid internship and will be 100% virtual for the duration of the program.
  • Arch MI also offers internships. All are Greensboro, NC-based and are posted through Campus Greensboro, campusgreensboro.org/apply. Non-local candidates are eligible to apply.

About Our Company
Arch Mortgage Insurance Company is the flagship U.S.-based mortgage insurer of Arch Capital Group Ltd., a leading insurance and reinsurance company operating through its subsidiaries worldwide. Based in Greensboro, North Carolina, our company is committed to our employees and our customers. Our Total Rewards package offers competitive pay and valuable benefits. Plus you’ll have access to a variety of programs supporting your professional development and a culture that encourages innovation, collaboration and professional growth

Intern, SCADA, Chelsea

Provides technical support to the MWRA SCADA group for various enhancement, maintenance, documentation and reporting projects. Works under the supervision of SCADA engineering staff.

Responsibilities

  • Assist SCADA engineering in operating system & applications software patching
  • Degauss retired hard drives and erase memory of retired network equipment
  • Use Microsoft Access to create and enhance a SCADA alarm report database following the model of a similar database used on another system
  • Update and Enhance the a Microsoft Access equipment inventory database
  • Create database intended to document the configuration and function of all SCADA system components
  • Update written procedures and system documentation
  • Create SCADA graphics in SCADA software
  • Implement network component log server
  • Research enhancements to Bro IDS software
  • Research use of OSSEC HIDS Software
  • Expand Network Monitoring System deployment

Qualifications

  • Computer Science or Engineering major
  • Minimum of 3rd year undergraduate student
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Access and Visual Basic for Applications (VBA)
  • Familiar with AutoCAD or other CAD program
  • Familiar with MS Visio
  • Proficiency with other Microsoft Office applications including Excel & Word
  • Proficient in technical writing
  • Understanding of cyber security concepts

Other Information:

Work Location: MWRA, 2 Griffin Way, Chelsea, MA

Compensation: based on education level

Work Schedule: Monday Friday 7 am 3:30 pm.

This is a three to six month internship.

How to Apply:

Apply online at www.mwra.com.

Massachusetts Water Resources Authority (MWRA) is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex or gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetics, or veteran status.

Description

Job Summary

Revance is daring to make a difference in the aesthetics market. Come be a part of our journey in setting a new standard. Our 2021 Summer Internship Program is scheduled to run from May 2021 until August 2021. This 12-week program is designed to provide students the opportunity to get a better understanding of the biotech pharma industry. This is a paid internship as a temporary employee, working up to 40 hours per week in our Nashville location.

Dare to make a difference? Be ready to be feel valued, developed, engaged, and empowered. The Risk Advisory and Compliance team at Revance Therapeutics is looking for an audacious Risk and Compliance Pioneer (Intern). Yes, Pioneer! You will work alongside specialists within our group to help develop the future of our function.

What do we do? We build awareness of what could go wrong and what to do about it. Our current focus areas include financial and information technology risks. We also keep our eyes open around technical and operational standards to secure and protect credit card data.

There is nothing like your own experience. An internship within the Risk Advisory and Compliance team at Revance Therapeutics not only offers an opportunity to build your skills and confidence, but also to work on projects that give you insight into who we are and what we do as a Biotech and Fintech Company (who’s growing at a rapid speed) as well as for the wider community.

You'll be assigned tasks to develop your understanding of what we really do, and you'll build networks with your colleagues in Finance and IT. Not only will you work on tasks that address the present needs but will help with tasks that drive value for the future of the team. Opportunity is at the heart of a career at Revance Therapeutics and our Risk Advisory and Compliance internship offers just that.


Essential Duties/Responsibilities

  • With appropriate guidance, focus on projects that research and detect valuable data sources to help automate collection processes and value driven data analysis
  • Identify data automation opportunities and help manage projects to refine the process by getting hands-on with data
  • Assist in reviewing large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns and information using data visualization techniques
  • Develop an understanding of Company risks through review of financial results, relevant internal information, current business trends, and specific transactions, relating to the world of SOX 404b (Financial and IT) and Payment Card Industry (PCI)
  • With appropriate guidance, execute and document testing of internal controls with clear explanations of procedures and results using appropriate standards and terminology
  • Build solid relationships with Finance and IT team members
  • Demonstrate flexibility with task completion and prioritization, communicating potential conflicts to a supervisor
  • Handle and analyze data and information responsibly
  • Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct
  • Prepare presentations, reports, and analytics
  • Collaborate with intern peers to propose solutions to real business problems
  • Execute a group project with fellow interns
  • Participate in the mentoring sessions, guest speaker series, and training modules
  • Participate in a community service program
  • Assist with the engagement survey action plan project
  • Other duties as assigned


Education

  • Current 3rd or 4th year students pursuing a BA/BS preferably in Computer Science, Data Science, Math, or similar
  • A strong academic record

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • The ability and willingness to work diligently and effectively remotely
  • Knowledge and understanding of a professional working environment
  • Excellent critical thinking and analysis skills, and the confidence to identify and resolve problems
  • Resilience to prioritize and adapt in a demanding, fast-moving, constantly changing environment
  • A proven record of excellence in communication and negotiation, supported by the technical writing skills to translate data into compelling stories and meaningful insights
  • Strong Microsoft Excel skills and knowledge of Microsoft D365 is a plus
  • Proactive and can-do attitude with strong attention to detail
  • Excellent organizational and follow-up skills
  • Previous internship experience preferred
  • Ability to prioritize tasks and handle multiple assignments simultaneously
  • Ability to work in teams and cultivate relationships
  • Intellectual curiosity; seeking opportunities to develop
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Demonstrated leadership or initiative at school, work and/or community

This is Not Your Everyday Job, and we're Not Your Everyday Company. James Moore & Co. is a leading CPA and consulting firm that serves clients throughout Florida, the United States and nearly 15 countries globally. Not only are we ranked by Accounting Today as one of the nation's Top 200 Accounting Firms to work for, we're also their #1 accounting firm for women! We've earned these honors and more because:

  • We love what we do.
  • Our people are awesome. We have marathon runners, cave divers, world travelers, foodies, veterans, sports fans, animal lovers, and more. We speak nearly ten languages and hail from eight countries around the world. We have family people, single people, and most importantly... happy people.
  • We offer a career with upward mobility and a work family (not just a job).
  • We asked our employees to give us one word that best represents James Moore. The unsurprising favorites were family, caring, fun, flexible and innovative.

But don't just take our word for it. See what our employees have to say:

"Having worked at two big 4 firms, I have to say that James Moore's culture blows the others out of the water."

"...The best part of working here is the people. Not only are they like family, but I learn from them too."

"...It is such an uplifting culture where I feel comfortable speaking to people at all levels and all divisions in the firm. Before, I felt like a number. Here, I feel like a part of a family of hard-working individuals that don't take themselves too seriously."

As an Information Technology Services Intern at James Moore & Co., P.L., you will gain valuable hands on experience in your field of study. This paid internship averages 20-30 hours per week from June 1-July 30 and is ideal for students as it offers a flexible schedule working around your curriculum.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Assist in installation of computer hardware and software both locally and remotely.
  • Assist in network and hardware troubleshooting.
  • Assist in performing preventative maintenance and software updates.
  • Perform hands on technical tasks such as setting up computers and network equipment.
  • Assist in needs analysis and research for projects.
  • Assist in updating user and technical documentation.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Must be tech savvy and enjoy working with people and computers
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work well in a team-based environment.
  • Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
  • Organized and helpdesk system ticket queues, notes, and solutions.
  • Local college graduate, or student having Senior level credits holding a 3.0 GPA or better.
  • Enrolled or graduated with an Information Science Technology BS, Computer Science BS, or Management Info Systems BS degree program.

James Moore & Co., CPAs is one of the top ten (10) regional accounting firms in Florida with offices in Daytona Beach, DeLand, Gainesville, and Tallahassee. Our practice includes tax, assurance, accounting & controllership, wealth management, HR solutions, technology solutions, corporate training and business advisory services. Our diverse industry specializations include start-up technology, healthcare, government, non-profit, manufacturing, higher education, construction and real estate. James Moore & Co., CPAs offers competitive salary, and flexible environment, balancing family and quality of life.

For more information about our Firm, please visit us at: www.jmco.com
