Job Brief

Aurora Flight Sciences, a Boeing Subsidiary, is seeking qualified Interns to actively participate in real-world assignments, help solve challenging problems and contribute to the development of the next-generation of autonomous aircraft.

Aurora is a leader in the development and manufacturing of advanced unmanned systems and aerospace vehicles.

Aurora Flight Sciences, a Boeing Subsidiary, is seeking qualified Interns to actively participate in real-world assignments, help solve challenging problems and contribute to the development of the next-generation of autonomous aircraft.

We Are Seeking Individuals With:

  • Structures Engineering or related experience.
  • A strong academic record.
  • Experience contributing to a team in a fast-paced, competitive and self-directed environment.

The duration of an internship typically lasts 8 - 12 weeks in any one of our sites:

Manassas, VA Headquarters, Engineering and Product Development
Cambridge, MA Research and Development
Bridgeport, WV Manufacturing
Columbus, MS Manufacturing and Final Assembly


Aurora offers a competitive compensation, housing and transportation allowance if required. Our mentors and team members guide you through your work, help you integrate in our culture of collaboration and further develop and gain new skills. Finally, during your time with us, we are interested in your input on how we can continue to enhance your experience in an environment of learning and at the end of your internship, we ask you to present your work experience and lessons learned to the company.


Requirements:

  • Enrollment in bachelor’s program with a focus in Engineering or a related field
  • Experience contributing to a team in a fast-paced/comparative and/or self-directed environment
  • Background knowledge in one of the following areas:
    • Aerospace/General Aviation
    • Flight Physics
    • Aerostructures
    • Computer Science
    • Autonomy
    • Robotics
    • Mechanical Systems
    • Propulsion
    • Manufacturing
    • Systems Engineering

Preferred Requirements:

  • Enrollment in a Master’s or PhD program
  • Participation in extracurricular activities

Physical Requirements:

  • The ability to travel to Aurora locations.

Aurora’s Mission

Aurora is a leader in the development and manufacturing of advanced unmanned systems and aerospace vehicles. Our mission is to apply autonomy and robotics to the development, production, and operation of advanced aircraft. We aim to change the way we travel. During the last three decades, Aurora has designed, rapid prototyped, and flown an average of one new vehicle a year for government and commercial customers. Now as an independent subsidiary of Boeing, Aurora’s innovation is combined with Boeing’s size and strength, creating an unprecedented opportunity to disrupt the future of the aerospace industry.

Come change the future of the aerospace industry with Aurora Flight Sciences.

Aurora Company Overview:

Aurora Flight Sciences, a Boeing Company, is a leader in the development and manufacturing of advanced unmanned systems and aerospace vehicles. position: Masters Intern - Network Science and Machine Learning
description:
Organization and Job ID

Job ID: 311881

Directorate: National Security

Division: Computing & Analytics

Group:Applied Statistics & Computational Modeling

Job Description

This position is for a student internship in Applied Network Science. Operating on the data-information-knowledge continuum, staff at PNNL employ diverse methods to confront significant problems of national interest – from distilling distributed data into knowledge that supports decision processes to enabling resilient technologies that enhance computing at extreme scales. This internship will involve designing new methods, implementing algorithms, and analyzing data that can be represented as a network. Examples of such data include citation networks, cyber systems, social networks, and many more.

The intern will work with computing researchers and practitioners to apply advanced theories, methods, algorithms, models, evaluation tools and testbeds, and computational-based solutions to address complex scientific challenges affecting energy, biological sciences, the environment, and national security. Initial studies will be around collaboration networks and influence identification. Familiarity with time-dynamic systems is also important.

Minimum Qualifications

Candidates must be matriculated/enrolled in a Master's program at an accredited college or university. Minimum GPA of 3.0 is required.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in python, C/C++/C# or java programming is preferred, but not required.

Familiarity with techniques from graph theory (network science) and machine learning.

Preferred Education

Candidates must be currently enrolled in a master's program in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science or related field and must have a proven research track record including publications. Cumulative GPA of 3.5 or higher preferred.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL) is seeking ambitious, high caliber sophomore, junior or senior high school students for intern assignments within the Student Research Apprenticeship Program (SRAP). The intern will be working on a project that works with Hector model development and analysis using the model's new tracked-carbon capability.

position: Low Level Read/Write and Diagnostics Firmware Summer Intern
description:
About our group:

Seagate delivers advanced digital storage solutions to meet the needs of today’s consumers and tomorrow’s applications. Through technology, leadership and innovation, Seagate continues to help individuals and businesses maximize the potential of their digital content in an ever-evolving, on-demand world. We are seeking an Intern to join our Low Level Read/Write and Diagnostics (LLRW-Diag) firmware team in Longmont, CO.

About the role - you will:

The LLRW-Diag firmware team is responsible for the design, development, test, and maintenance of the code in the Low Level Read/Write and Diagnostics firmware subsystems. In this role, the candidate would be supporting the team in various assigned tasks such as development/enhancements of diagnostic commands, maintaining/enhancing firmware documentation/tools, resolving machine identified coding issues, etc.

About you:

  • Ability to solve complex and dynamic problems.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with confidence in presenting to groups.
  • Comfortability with and interest in working in fast paced environment of tech industry.
  • Self-motivated with desire to learn.

Your experience includes:

  • Currently pursuing Bachelor’s or Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering or related degree and must be returning to school in fall 2021.
  • Structured programming skills and excellent analytical skills.
  • Experience with C/C++
  • Proficient in a scripting language (Python)
  • Knowledge in embedded C

Location:

Our Longmont product-design campus is nestled against the foothills with exceptional views of the Rocky Mountains. Here at work, you can grab breakfast and lunch in the on-site cafeteria or get an afternoon espresso, prepared by a professional barista. Our 1,500+ employees enjoy an active on-site experience from sporting activities (get in a few laps at lunch on our 1-mile walking path around campus, play ping-pong or volleyball, or stop in our 24- hour fitness center for a group or individual workout) to community service and many employee resource groups including Pride!, Women’s Leadership Network and a Young Professionals Network.


Interns typically work hours Monday thru Friday between 8am to 5pm. Part-time schedules may flex with academic schedules and availability.

The hours are subject to change with or without notice at the sole discretion of Seagate.
